parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An identifier for the entity with the overall regulatory responsibility for the protocol.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: In some cases, the combination of Sponsor ID with Study ID and Site ID might be needed by external parties (e.g., CRO or for a multisponsor study) to uniquely identify sites belonging to the study for the given sponsor.
cdashModelFields.label: Sponsor
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: For the SDTM dataset, the value in the CDASH field SPONSOR maps to the SDTM variable TSVAL. The SDTM variable TSPARMCD is populated with "SPONSOR" and the SDTM variable TSPARM is populated with "Clinical Study Sponsor".
cdashModelFields.name: SPONSOR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66734

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A 2-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This field can be derived into the database or created during SDTM dataset creation before submission. The domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.
cdashModelFields.label: Domain Abbreviation
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
cdashModelFields.label: Study Identifier
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
cdashModelFields.label: Study Site Identifier
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: For the SDTM dataset, the value in the CDASH field SITEID maps to the SDTM variable DM.SITEID.
cdashModelFields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An identifier to describe the investigator for the study.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: May be used in addition to the SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID.
cdashModelFields.label: Investigator Identifier
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: For the SDTM dataset, the value in the CDASH field SITEID maps to the SDTM variable DM.INVID.
cdashModelFields.name: INVID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. The recording of multiple SUBJID for the same subject is a known SDTM issue. If a subject is screened more than once, there may be more than one SUBJID per instance of being screened within the trial. See FDA Study Data Technical Conformance Guide, Section 4.1.1.2.a
cdashModelFields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: For the SDTM dataset, the value in the CDASH field SUBJID maps to the SDTM variable DM.SUBJID.
cdashModelFields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An identifier used to indicate a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen (as described in the protocol), for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1") or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye) or "Upper left quadrant of the back"). The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This SDTM variable was defined in SDTM v1.5, but was not included in SDTMIG 3.2. Sponsors should consider the SDTM version being used when creating submission datasets. If using pre-SDTM 1.5, the CDASH-to-SDTM mapping may need to be defined by the sponsor because FOCID was not a valid SDTM variable in these versions.
cdashModelFields.label: Focus of Study Specific Interest
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: FOCID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
cdashModelFields.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
cdashModelFields.name: --SPID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Used to link together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. This group identifier may be used to tie together all the tests collected in a Findings domain using a denormalized approach (see CDASHIG Section 8.3.1, General CDASH Assumptions for Findings Domains). This field may be populated by the sponsor's data management system.
cdashModelFields.label: Group ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --GRPID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An identifier used to link related records across domains.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This may be a one-to- one or a one-to-many relationship. Example: A single tumor may have multiple measurements/assessments performed at each study visit.
cdashModelFields.label: Link ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LNKID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An identifier used to link related records across domains.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. Example: Multiple tumor measurements/assessments will contribute to a single response-to-therapy determination record.
cdashModelFields.label: Link Group ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --LNKGRP

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: An internal or external identifier (e.g., lab specimen ID, UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image).
cdashModelFields.label: Reference ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: --REFID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A numerical identifier for the adverse event that is associated with/related to this intervention/finding/event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Name of the identifying variable is stored in the SDTM variable IDVAR (e.g., --AENO) and the value of the SDTM variable IDVAR is stored in SDTM variable IDVARVAL. Example question text: What was the identifier for the adverse event associated with this concomitant medication?
cdashModelFields.label: Related Adverse Event ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create the RELREC dataset to link this record with a record in the associated Adverse Events domain.
cdashModelFields.name: --AENO
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the identifier for the adverse event(s) [associated with/related to this intervention/finding/event]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A numerical identifier for the medical history event that is associated with/related to this intervention/finding/event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Name of the identifying variable is stored as a value in the SDTM variable IDVAR (e.g., "--MHNO") and the value of the IDVAR is stored in the STDM variable IDVARVAL. Example question text prompt: What was the identifier for the medical history event associated with this concomitant medication?
cdashModelFields.label: Related Medical History Event ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create the RELREC dataset to link this record with a record in the associated Medical History domain.
cdashModelFields.name: --MHNO
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the identifier for the medical history event(s) [associated with/related to this intervention/finding/event]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A numerical identifier for the procedure that is associated with/related to this intervention/finding/event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Name of the identifying variable is stored as a value in the SDTM variable IDVAR (e.g., "--PRNO") and the value of the IDVAR is stored in the SDTM variable IDVARVAL. Example question text for an Adverse Event CRF: What was the identifier for the procedure associated with this adverse event?
cdashModelFields.label: Related Procedure ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create the RELREC dataset to link this record with a record in the associated Procedures domain.
cdashModelFields.name: --PRNO
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the identifier for the procedure(s) [associated with/related to this intervention/finding/event]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A numerical identifier for the clinical event that is associated with/related to this intervention/finding/event.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: Name of the identifying variable is stored as a value in the SDTM variable IDVAR ("--CENO") and the value of the IDVAR is stored in the SDTM variable IDVARVAL Example question text: What was the identifier for the clinical event associated with this procedure?
cdashModelFields.label: Related Clinical Event ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create the RELREC dataset to link this record with a record in the associated Clinical Events domain.
cdashModelFields.name: --CENO
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the identifier for the clinical event(s) [associated with/related to this intervention/finding/event]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier for a device.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: SPDEVID is a constructed variable consisting of elements that may not be available at the time of data capture (e.g., device type, manufacturer). Other device identifiers, such as serial number, may instead be used on the CRF. If this is the case, sponsors should use controlled terminology for the SPDEVID elements as variable names where possible. Sponsors should also ensure that, when necessary, those elements required for deriving SPDEVID are captured.
cdashModelFields.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: SPDEVID
cdashModelFields.questionText: What [is/was] the sponsor identifier for the device?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Model Version 1.2

cdashModelFields.definition: The identifier for a non-host organism; should only be used when the organism is the subject of the test.
cdashModelFields.implementationNotes: This sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism should only be used when the organism is the subject of the test.
cdashModelFields.label: Non-host Organism ID
cdashModelFields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
cdashModelFields.name: NHOID
